meanings.definition: A person or thing that leans.
meanings.sent1: The tree had many leaners against its trunk for support.
meanings.sent2: The old building had several leaners holding it up.
meanings.sent3: The group of leaners formed a human pyramid for fun.
meanings.sent4: The leaners in the tower of blocks caused it to collapse.
meanings.sent5: The line of leaners against the wall looked like a row of dominoes ready to fall.

meanings.sent1: The injured player needed a leaner to help him walk.
meanings.sent2: The table wobbled until they added a leaner for stability.
meanings.sent3: The chair with a missing leg needed a book as a temporary leaner.
meanings.sent4: The leaning tower was saved from falling by a strong leaner.
meanings.sent5: The bridge was reinforced with additional leaners to bear the weight of the cars.

meanings.definition: A person who leans towards a particular political or social viewpoint.
meanings.sent1: She was known as a leaner towards environmental causes.
meanings.sent2: The group of leaners supported the new policy proposal.
meanings.sent3: The leaner for animal rights always brought her dog to work.
meanings.sent4: The leaner for equality fought for fair treatment for all.
meanings.sent5: The leaner for education reform had innovative ideas for change.
